senses.de: Happening or coming one after the other without a break
senses.ex: Their team has had three successive wins this season.

Tips.title: Chronological Order
Tips.description: Use 'successive' to indicate items or events follow each other in time.
Tips.example: She won successive rounds in the spelling bee.

Tips.title: No Interruption
Tips.description: 'Successive' implies there are no gaps or interruptions between events or items.
Tips.example: The detective investigated successive clues found at the scene.

Tips.title: Emphasizing Repetition
Tips.description: Use 'successive' to emphasize repetition, especially in the case of remarkable achievements or failures.
Tips.example: The athlete broke the world record at two successive Olympic games.

Consecutive.wordDefinition:
The words consecutive and successive both refer to something that happens one after the other, but there is a subtle difference between the two.

Consecutive means that something is happening in a sequence without any breaks or interruptions. For example, if someone says they have gone to the gym for 10 consecutive days, it means they went to the gym for 10 days in a row without skipping a day.

To summarize, consecutive refers to something that happens without any breaks, while successive refers to something that happens in a sequence with some breaks or interruptions in between.

Continuous.wordDefinition:
Continuous means uninterrupted or without any break, while the word successive means one after another.

For example, if you are watching a movie without any pause, it is a continuous viewing experience. If you watch three different movies one after another, they can be called successive viewings.

Continuous describes something that does not stop or pause, while successive describes a series of events or objects that follow each other in a consecutive order.

Cumulative.wordDefinition:
Cumulative refers to something that increases or grows gradually over time as each individual part is added to the whole.

For example, the cumulative effect of studying a little bit every day can result in a better overall understanding of a subject.

Cumulative emphasizes gradual accumulation or increase of something, while successive focuses on the order or sequence of events.

Cumulative is applicable in situations where the end result is achieved by adding up smaller parts or contributions, whereas successive is applicable in situations where things occur in a specific order or sequence.

Gradual.wordDefinition:
Gradual means something that happens slowly or step by step, while successive means something that happens one after the other, often in a predictable sequence.

For example, a person might gradually improve their tennis skills by practicing regularly and steadily over time. A company might have successive rounds of lay-offs as they try to reduce costs.

Gradual describes a slow but steady change or process, while successive describes a sequence of events that occur one after the other.

Progressive.wordDefinition:
Progressive means to gradually move forward or improve over time. For example, a progressive approach to education might involve constantly updating and improving teaching methods to keep up with modern technology and theories.

Progressive describes things that are changing or improving over time, while successive describes things that occur one after the other in a chronological order.

Sequential.wordDefinition:
Sequential refers to something that is arranged in a specific order or sequence, whereas successive refers to something that occurs one after the other without interruption.

For example, if you are making a recipe for brownies, the steps must be done in a sequential order (i.e. mix dry ingredients, then wet ingredients, then mix together).

Serial.wordDefinition:
Serial refers to something that occurs in a sequence, with each event following the previous one. It implies that there is a connection between the events, such as in a serial killer who commits a series of related murders.

To summarize: serial implies a connection between events, while successive does not. Use serial when talking about a sequence of related events, and successive when talking about anything that happens one after another.

Subsequent.wordDefinition:
Both subsequent and successive mean “following in order or sequence,” but there is a subtle difference in how they are used.

Subsequent is often used to describe events or actions that follow, but not necessarily immediately. For example, “The subsequent investigation found no evidence of foul play.”.

In simpler terms, subsequent means something that happens after another event or action, while successive means a series of events or actions that happen one after the other, usually quickly.

If you’re talking about events that happen over a longer period of time, use subsequent. If you’re talking about events that happen quickly one after the other, use successive.

quotes.Text: How great is the mystery of the first cells which were one day animated by the breath of our souls! How impossible to decipher the welding of successive influences in which we are forever incorporated! In each one of us, through matter, the whole history of the world is in part reflected.
quotes.Title: French Philosopher
quotes.Name: Pierre Teilhard de Chardin

quotes.Text: When you start with a portrait and search for a pure form, a clear volume, through successive eliminations, you arrive inevitably at the egg. Likewise, starting with the egg and following the same process in reverse, one finishes with the portrait.
quotes.Title: Spanish Painter
quotes.Name: Pablo Picasso

quotes.Text: Italy has piled up huge public debt because the successive governments were too close to the life of ordinary citizens, too willing to please the requests of everybody, thereby acting against the interests of future generations.
quotes.Title: Italian Public Servant
quotes.Name: Mario Monti

quotes.Text: War, we are told, shapes character; it resolves the major questions of international politics, consolidates nations, and indeed, constitutes the principal factor in the progress of civilization through its successive stages.
quotes.Title: Swiss Activist
quotes.Name: Elie Ducommun

quotes.Text: Each successive period of progress is a period more humane and spiritual. The only logical conclusion is that all is Mind and its manifestation, from the rolling of worlds, in the most subtle ether, to a potato-patch.
quotes.Title: American Theologian
quotes.Name: Mary Baker Eddy

quotes.Text: The NFL has been an amazing page in this chapter of my life. I pray that all successive adventures offer me the same potential for growth, success and most importantly fun.
quotes.Title: American Football Player
quotes.Name: Ricky Williams

quotes.Text: I am an intelligent river which has reflected successively all the banks before which it has flowed by meditating only on the images offered by those changing shores.
quotes.Title: French Author
quotes.Name: Victor Hugo

quotes.Text: At the time the Sendmail program had a very poor reputation with respect to security, with four root vulnerabilities per year for two successive years.
quotes.Title: Dutch Scientist
quotes.Name: Wietse Venema

quotes.Text: Every day is like that, eight successive meetings on eight different topics, every one really important and interesting.
quotes.Title: American Economist
quotes.Name: Peter Orszag

quotes.Text: To be the first player in the world to take part in three successive World Cup finals is very important.
quotes.Name: Cafu
